contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox rugby biography | name = Jake Howard | image = | birth_name = John Leslie Patrick Howard | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1945|8|30|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Bexley, New South Wales]] | height = | weight = | nickname = | occupation = | school = [[St Joseph's College, Hunters Hill|St Joseph's College]]<ref name="Howell">Howell pp226</ref> | university = | spouse = | children = [[Pat Howard]] | relatives = [[Cyril Towers]] | ru_position = [[Prop (rugby union)|Prop]] | ru_amateuryears = | ru_amateurclubs = | ru_clubyears = | ru_proclubs = | ru_clubcaps = | ru_clubpoints = | super14years = | super14 = | super14caps = | super14points = | ru_provinceyears = | ru_province = | ru_provincecaps = | ru_provincepoints = | ru_nationalyears = 1970–1973 | ru_nationalteam = {{ru|AUS}} | ru_nationalcaps = 7 | ru_nationalpoints = (0) | ru_sevensnationalyears = | ru_sevensnationalteam = | ru_sevensnationalcomp = | website = }} '''Jake Howard''' (born 30 August 1945 in [[Bexley, New South Wales]]) is a former international rugby footballer who played prop for [[Australia national rugby union team|Australia]]. Howard was schooled at [[St. Joseph's College, Hunters Hill]] and then played his club rugby with Sydney's, [[Sydney university]]. He also took up rowing at the senior level with the [[Sydney Rowing Club]].<ref name="SJC News p13">''SJC News'', article by James Gray p13</ref> He stroked a junior VIII for the club in 1964 and stroked a coxed pair to a State Championship in the 1964/65 season.<ref>[http://www.rowinghistory-aus.info/club-histories/sydney/11-4.php Guerin-Foster History of Austn Rowing]</ref> Howard made his international rugby debut on the 6 June 1970 against [[Scotland national rugby union team|Scotland]] and went on to make six further international representative appearances between 1970 and 1973. His final Test appearance was on the 1973 tour of Wales and England. His son [[Pat Howard]]<ref name="courier">{{cite web|url=http://www.news.com.au/couriermail/story/0,23739,22179259-10389,00.html|title=Howard to chart course|last=Tucker|first=Jim|date=2 August 2007|publisher=couriermail.com.au|accessdate=2009-10-04}}</ref> (born 1973) also played centre and fly-half for the Wallabies. Jake Howard was the son-in-law of [[Australia national rugby union team|Wallaby]] [[Cyril Towers]].<ref name="courier" /> ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==Published sources== * Howell, Max (2006) ''Born to Lead - Wallaby Test Captains (2005)'' Celebrity Books, New Zealand ==External links== * [http://www.scrum.com/australia/rugby/player/7648.html Scrum.com profile] {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2010}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Howard, Jake | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Australian rugby union player | DATE OF BIRTH =30 August 1945 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Bexley, New South Wales]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Howard, Jake}} [[Category:1945 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Australian rugby union players]] [[Category:People educated at St Joseph's College, Hunters Hill]] [[Category:Australia international rugby union players]]
